definition: easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
(idiomatic usage) with great difficulty/to have a hard time (convincing sb, relinquishing sth etc)/(literal usage) so easy
it's easier to invite the devil in than to send him away
pinyin: qing3 shen2 rong2 yi4 song4 shen2 nan2
lai2 de5 rong2 yi4 , qu4 de5 kuai4

sentences.english: Partners are less likely to feel ignored or disrespected.
sentences.chinese: 同伴也不容易感到被忽视或者不受尊重。

sentences.english: A Single Con Panna is a delicious coffee drink that's easy to make.
sentences.chinese: 一个单一浓度潘纳是一种美味的咖啡饮料，很容易使。

sentences.english: The quite demeanor of the Capricorn is easily misinterpreted as cold and hard hearted.
sentences.chinese: 摩羯的这种表现很容易让人误解为冷漠和硬心肠。

sentences.english: True extremely not easily Huan Yao brave the life disturbances facing.
sentences.chinese: 人生的风风雨雨真的很不容易还要勇敢的面对。

sentences.english: Learning how to striptease is not difficult.
sentences.chinese: 学习跳脱衣舞十分容易。

sentences.english: The problem is that it is easily misapplied.
sentences.chinese: 问题是它很容易被误用。

sentences.english: High viscosity oils produce foam with small bubbles that do not break easily.
sentences.chinese: 高粘度油产生泡沫的小气泡，不容易突破。

sentences.english: Applying the market rule to electronic unfair competition disputes is not always easy.
sentences.chinese: 运用该市场规律来消除电子不正当竞争并不容易。

sentences.english: Naturally, the process of coming up with this list wasn't always easy.
sentences.chinese: 当然，拿出这份书名目录的过程中并非总是很容易的。

sentences.english: "Electronics are a lot easier to compare online, " Robertson said.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特森认为，“网上更容易比较电子产品的价格。

sentences.english: 'The longer you've known someone, the easier that conversation is, ' Dr. Epperly adds.
sentences.chinese: 艾伯利医生说，你认识病患越久，这种对话就越容易。

sentences.english: Her feelings of affection are dormant but easily awakened.
sentences.chinese: 她的钟爱之情蛰伏着但很容易被唤醒。

sentences.english: The tools of media will become more easy to use and more affordable.
sentences.chinese: 媒体工具会变得更加容易操作，更加便宜。

sentences.english: Or maybe it is because trees, in the scheme of development, provide an easy compromise.
sentences.chinese: 又或许是在发展的进程表中，树让人更容易让步。

sentences.english: Say, read the book you see smoke on the fetal well, easy to teratogenicity .
sentences.chinese: 就说你看到书上写着抽烟对胎儿不好，容易致畸。

definition: easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
usually/in many cases/more often than not
in case (sth happens)/if/once (sth happens, then...)/when/in a short time/in one day
to avert/to prevent/to avoid/to refrain from
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
to avoid as taboo/to avoid by all means
